subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Founder Mode vs. Manager Mode
description: Learn Founder Mode vs. Manager Mode in one minute.

hook.text: Paul Graham wrote that founders who run companies like managers kill the magic. 'Founder mode' is different.

buildup.text: Manager mode delegates everything. Founder mode means staying close to the product and customers.

discovery.text: Steve Jobs skipped management layers to talk directly to engineers. That's classic founder mode.

twist.text: Founder mode doesn't scale perfectly. At some point, every founder must learn to let goâ€”selectively.

climax.text: The best founders blend both: hands-on where it matters, delegating everywhere else.

punchline.text: Stay close to the work. Delegate the rest.

quiz.question: What is 'founder mode' as described by Paul Graham?
options: Staying deeply involved with the product and customers rather than purely delegating
Making all company decisions without any input
